sec.p: Additional Supporting Information may be found in the online version of this article:

Table S1. Overview of samples used in this study with information regarding sample ID, source of DNA, specimen ID of the museum samples, geographic origin, sampling date, sex and inclusion or exclusion in population genetic analyses.
Table S2. Microsatellite loci (according to Leder et al. 2008), forward and reverse primer sequences (5 - 3'), labeling dye and final primer concentrations used for the multiplex PCR.
Table S3. Pairwise F st comparisons between all populations: A) based on control region, B) based on microsatellite loci and C) based on clock gene loci.

Table S4. Mean number of Clock-gene Q repeats in male and female pied flycatchers ( F. hypoleuca) found in different populations over space and time (both alleles added for each individual); n.a. = not analyzed separately for sexes due to a large number of nestling specimens without sex determination.
Figure S1. Median joining mtDNA haplotype network of recent European F. hypoleuca populations.
Figure S2. Barplot of a Bayesian clustering analysis using Structure, of recent F. hypoleuca individuals for the most likely K (4).
